pr_title: Create Event in case of OOBM failure

timeline.bodyText: In general in CloudStack we try to not log the 'hostid' as it doesn't say anything. The ID can only be fetched from the DB and not from the API and thus UI.
timeline.author: wido

replies.bodyText: Makes sense, I am going to keep only the host name then.
replies.author: GabrielBrascher

timeline.author: wido

timeline.bodyText:
I know there is no naming scheme here, but isn't it easier if OOB related config keys are prefixed with oob?
oob.create.event.on.failure
For example

replies.bodyText:
Thanks for the suggestion, @wido.
I am removing that global settings config key. There are too many config keys already, I am leaving to add a new one only if it is really necessary.
